text: Matching kinchaku bags is a traditional Japanese drawstring bag, used like a handbag (similar to the English reticule) for carrying around personal possessions. Larger versions can be used to carry bento boxes (packed lunchboxes) and utensils, etc. ==See also== * Furoshiki * Inrō == External links == Category:Bags (fashion) Category:Japanese fashion
title: Kinchaku
